name: PSCodeHealth
description: Gather PowerShell code quality metrics and enforce quality gates based on these metrics
author: Mathieu Buisson

inputs.name: SourceCodePath
inputs.label: Path to Analyze
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the directory to search for PowerShell files to analyze (it can also be a single script or module). If empty, it defaults to the root of the repo.

inputs.name: Recurse
inputs.label: Search PowerShell files in subdirectories
inputs.helpMarkDown: To search PowerShell files in 'Path to Analyze' and (if it is a folder) all subdirectories recursively.

inputs.name: Exclude
inputs.label: File(s) to exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown: File(s) to exclude from the code analysis (1 per line). Enter a path element or pattern. Wildcards are permitted.

inputs.name: TestsPath
inputs.label: Pester Tests Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the file or directory where Pester tests are located. If empty, it defaults to the same location as 'Path to Analyze'.

inputs.name: GenerateHtmlReport
inputs.label: Generate an HTML report
inputs.helpMarkDown: To instruct PSCodeHealth to generate a report as an HTML file.

inputs.name: HtmlReportPath
inputs.label: HTML report path (including file name)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path and file name of the generated HTML report. If empty, it defaults to `$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)\PSCodeHealth.html`
